description: Triangle T(n,k)=M(2n,k,-1), 0<=k<=n, n >= 0, array M as in A050144.
comments: Sometimes called Catalan's triangle, although this term is usually reserved for several other triangles!T is a mirror image of the array in A039598.Given (1) = row 0, then the sum of terms with alternating signs in row r of A050166 = (-1)^r * A000108(n); where A000108 = 1, 1, 2, 5, 14, 42...the Catalan numbers. - _Herb Conn_The diagonals of this triangle are self-convolutions of the main diagonal A000108(n+1) : 1, 2, 5, 14, 42, 132, 429, . . . - _Philippe Deléham_, May 25 2005
